column1: | for patricia ann weaver patricia ann weaver
column4: passed away peacefully at home with her family by her side on june 21
column5: 2015. she was born the daughter of edward and lillian {fitzsimmons} woodard on december 20
column7: in georgetown. she was united in marriage to phillip weaver on may 20
column9: at georgetown united methodist church. he will miss her dearly. she will also be missed by: her twin daughters
column10: melinda (richard) long of catlin & malia (joseph) pelszynski of danville; her son
column11: doug (jan) weaver of catlin; her grandchildren
column23: shirley kight of le. high acres
column25: connie pennington of danville & scott (helen) kight of le. high acres
column26: fl. she was preceded in death by her parents and her sister
column27: mary green. patricia was a bookkeeper and had worked for prairie states oil & grease
column28: then later for first national bank of georgetown
column29: and then as treasurer for the georgetown-ridge farm school district. she was a member of the first united methodist church in catlin. she played in the bell choir & was a communion steward. patricia enjoyed doing crossword puzzles
column33: & having family dinners. she will be dearly remembered by all who knew and loved her. a celebration of patricias life will be held at 2:00pm
column39: with pastor curtis flake officiating. visitation will be 4pm-7pm
column43: at the funeral home. she will be laid to rest in georgetown cemetery. memorial donations may be given in her name to first united methodist church of catlin church memorial fund. to send flowers or a remembrance gift to the family of patricia ann weaver please visit our tribute store. upcoming events24. jun. wednesday visitation4:00 pm - 7:00 pm sunset's houghton-leasure funeral chapel200 e. west street
